title: Virtual Conversation: Fracture Lines: Jan and Benedikte Groth's Tegn I (Sign)
title_display: Virtual Conversation: Fracture Lines—Jan and Benedikte Groth's Tegn I (Sign)
hero_caption: Jan Groth and Benedikte Groth. Tegn I (Sign), 1970. Edward E. Ayer Endowment in memory of Charles L. Hutchinson.
short_description: The tapestry Tegn I (Sign) (1970), created by Jan and Benedikte Groth, forms the locus for this conversation about the hierarchy of art forms in the post-1945 period. Associate curator of Textiles Erica Warren and Rhoades curatorial intern Hanne Graversen discuss the ways in which questions of medium, gender, and nationality inform such perceived hierarchies.
list_description: Associate curator of Textiles Erica Warren and Rhoades curatorial intern Hanne Graversen discuss how questions of medium, gender, and nationality inform the hierarchy of art forms.
description:
The tapestry Tegn I (Sign) (1970), created by Jan and Benedikte Groth, forms the locus for this conversation about the hierarchy of art forms in the post-1945 period. Associate curator of Textiles Erica Warren and Rhoades curatorial intern Hanne Graversen discuss the ways in which questions of medium, gender, and nationality inform such perceived hierarchies.

This virtual event will be hosted on Zoom. Find Zoom tutorials and resources here. If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
